eg.syntax

Class SyntaxHighlighter.SyntaxSearcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • eg.syntax.SyntaxHighlighter.SyntaxSearcher
  • Enclosing class:
    SyntaxHighlighter

    public class SyntaxHighlighter.SyntaxSearcher
extends java.lang.Object
    The search of text elements for setting character attributes in TextDocument.
    Class is created in the enclosing class and has no public constructor.

        public void setCharAttrBlack()
        Sets the section of text that is to be highlighted to black and plain

      • keywords

        public void keywords(java.lang.String[] keys,
                     boolean reqWord,
                     javax.swing.text.SimpleAttributeSet set)
        Highlights keywords
        Parameters:
        keys - the array of keywords
        reqWord - the boolean that, if true, indicates that keywords must be whole words
        set - the SimpleAttributeSet set on the keywords

      • keywords

        public void keywords(java.lang.String[] keys,
                     char[] nonWordStart,
                     boolean openingBrace,
                     javax.swing.text.SimpleAttributeSet set)
        Highlights keywords if these are whole words and if an opening brace is or is rather not found ahead of the keywords, depending on the specfied openingBrace
        Parameters:
        keys - the array of keywords
        nonWordStart - the array of characters that the keyword must not be preceded with, in addition to digits and letters. Can be null
        openingBrace - true if an opening brace must be found ahead of keywords, false if rather no opening brace or a closing brace must be found
        set - the SimpleAttributeSet set on the keywords

      • extensibleKeyword

        public void extensibleKeyword(java.lang.String keyBase,
                              java.lang.String[] keyExtensions,
                              char[] nonWordStart,
                              boolean openingBrace,
                              javax.swing.text.SimpleAttributeSet set)
        Highlights an extensible keyword if this is a whole word and if an opening brace is or is rather not found ahead of the keyword, depending on the specfied openingBrace
        Parameters:
        keyBase - the base keyword
        keyExtensions - the array of strings that may extend the keyword
        nonWordStart - the array of characters that the keyword must not be preceded with, in addition to digits and letters. Can be null
        openingBrace - true if an opening brace must be found ahead of keywords, false if rather no opening brace or a closing brace must be found
        set - the SimpleAttributeSet set on the keywords

      • signedVariables

        public void signedVariables(char[] startChars,
                            char[] endChars,
                            javax.swing.text.SimpleAttributeSet set)
        Highlights variables that start with one of the characters in startChars and end with one of the characters in endChars
        Parameters:
        startChars - the array start characters
        endChars - the array of end characters
        set - the SimpleAttributeSet set on the variables

      • signedVariables

        public void signedVariables(char[] startChars,
                            char[] endChars,
                            boolean openingBrace,
                            javax.swing.text.SimpleAttributeSet set)
        Highlights variables that start with one of the characters in startChars and end with one of the characters in endChars and if an opening brace is or is rather not found ahead of the keywords, depending on the specfied openingBrace
        Parameters:
        startChars - the array start characters
        endChars - the array of end characters
        openingBrace - true if an opening brace must be found ahead of keywords, false if rather no opening brace or a closing brace must be found
        set - the SimpleAttributeSet set on the variables

      • htmlTags

        public void htmlTags(java.lang.String[] tags,
                     java.lang.String[] attributes)
        Highlights html tags with attributes. Tags are shown in blue and bold, attributes in red and attribute values in purple
        Parameters:
        tags - the array of html tags
        attributes - the array of html attributes

        public void lineComments(java.lang.String lineCmntStart,
                         char[] nonCmntStart)
        Highlights line comments in green
        Parameters:
        lineCmntStart - the string that marks the start of a line comment
        nonCmntStart - the array of characters that disable highlighting if one of these precede lineCmtStart. Can be null.

        Highlights block comments in green
        Parameters:

      • unHighlight

        public void unHighlight(java.lang.String unHghlStart,
                        char[] unHghlEnd)
        Sets sections to plain and black that are exceptionally not to be highlighted
        Parameters:
        unHghlStart - the string that marks the start of the section
        unHghlEnd - the array of characters that mark the end of the section

      • isInBlockCmnt

        public boolean isInBlockCmnt(java.lang.String blockCmntStart,
                             java.lang.String blockCmntEnd)
        Returns the boolean that, if true, indicates that the position where a change happened is found inside a block comment. Returns false regardless of the position if this section to be highlighted is multiline
        Parameters:
        blockCmntStart - the string that marks the start of a comment
        blockCmntEnd - the string that marks the end of a comment
        Returns:
        the boolean value
